intro: Stoebe mucida, commonly known as sticky germander, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves that give it a sticky texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. Stoebe mucida is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
